lead_paragraph: Robert L. Nardelli, the chief executive of Home Depot, who came under heavy criticism for his pay package and failure to lift the chain’s stagnant stock price, has abruptly resigned, the company said today.

headline.main: Embattled Chief Executive Resigns at Home Depot

abstract: Home Depot, the giant home-improvement chain, said Wednesday that Robert L. Nardelli resigned as its chairman and chief executive. Mr. Nardelli’s departure, which the company said was part of a mutual agreement, comes amid mounting criticism of Home Depot’s executive compensation practices and its flagging stock price.

headline.main: Home Depot’s Chief Resigns as Proxy Fight Looms

abstract: When you are carrying $210 million in goodies, it is hard to make a quiet exit. This is especially true when you are Robert Nardelli, whose pay as the chief executive of Home Depot has long been a source of controversy. Hours after his resignation was announced early Wednesday, there were some strong reactions to Mr. Nardelli’s severance package, which the company valued at $210 million.
